paragraphs.text: Russia's next acquisition.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: It is no secret that Russia views the South Caucasus as being in its natural sphere of influence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In light of Russia's annexation of Crimea, and on the back of Moscow's recent treaties with Abkhazia and South Ossetia, Georgians have legitimate reasons to believe that Russian activity in their country will only increase in 2015
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Consequently
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: many are keeping a close eye on the Georgian province of Samtskhe-Javakheti- a majority ethnically Armenian region located just three hours' drive from the nation's capital city of Tbilisi
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Causing instability in Samtskhe-Javakheti would achieve two goals for Moscow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: First
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it would further dismember the territorial integrity of Georgia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Georgian provinces of South Ossetia and Abkhazia are already under Russian occupation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: By some accounts they are closer than ever to being annexed by Moscow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: An independent Samtskhe-Javakheti, or one under Russian influence, would divide Georgia down the middle
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Armenian separatism in Samtskhe-Javakheti might not be as vocal as it was only a few years ago
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there is still a fear that Moscow could easily reenergise separatist movements in the region
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Secondly, and more importantly for Russia, bringing the region under Moscow's influence would make a land corridor between Russia and Armenia, via South Ossetia, one step closer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is important
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because Russia maintains a sizeable military presence in Armenia
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The bulk of the Russian force is based in the city of Gyumri and consists of approximately 5,000 soldiers and dozens of fighter planes and attack helicopters
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Russia has long had the difficult challenge of supplying these forces
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: especially since Georgia and Turkey refuse transit rights
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This has left a reliance on Iran
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which for obvious reasons, is not ideal for Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is not only for Russia that Samtskhe-Javakheti is strategically important, but also for Europe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Baku-Tbilisi-Ceyhan pipeline and the South Caucasus Pipeline, carrying oil and gas respectively from the Caspian Sea to the Mediterranean Sea, passes through the province
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the possibility of more Central Asian oil and gas finding its way to Europe becomes likely
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: these pipelines bypassing Russia will become a vital part of Europe's energy security
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In addition
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Kars-Tbilisi-Baku railway, which is due to open later this year, passes through Samtskhe-Javakheti
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It is expected that this rail line will eventually transport 3 million passengers and over 15 million tons of freight each year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is a perfect storm brewing in the region
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Russia wanted to exploit the situation in Samtskhe-Javakheti
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it could not ask for better timing than now
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: First is the fact that many Javakheti Armenians have Russian sympathies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Until its closure in 2007, the Russian military base there was the single biggest source of employment
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: It has also been reportedthat Moscow is issuing Russian passports to ethnic Armenians living in the region
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This in itself is telling
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Russia issued passports to Abkhazians and South Ossetians just before its 2008 invasion of Georgia and also issued passports to Crimeans ahead of the annexation of Crimea last year
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But Russia is only part of the problem
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many of the grievances Javakheti Armenians have are a result of poor policy making by the central government in Tbilisi
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many Javakheti Armenians feel that their culture and language are discriminated against
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There has been a decrease in the quality of education among the Javakheti Armenian population
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The bilingual education program of teaching in both Georgian and Armenian has been described as a "total failure"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because there are not enough qualified teachers with proficiency in both languages
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Unemployment is high in Samtskhe-Javakheti
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: future economic prospects in the region look bleak
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many Javakheti Armenians travel to Russia or Armenia for work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Economy strained
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Thanks to the drop in the value of the Russian ruble - almost one-third of its value in the past year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: remittances have also decreased
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The unusually harsh winter in the region is placing a further strain on economic activity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Then there is the issue of citizenship and immigration
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many Javakheti Armenians do not have Georgian citizenship
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Instead
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: many hold Armenian passports
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: because finding seasonal work in Armenia and Russia is easier this way
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Until recently, Armenian citizens were allowed to live and work inside Georgia without any special authorisation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as long as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they crossed the border back into Armenia at least once a year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Last September this changed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Now Javakheti Armenians without Georgian citizenship can only stay in Georgia for three months at a time
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Longer term residency permits are costly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These policies breed animosity and form a perfect storm that could easily be exploited by Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It does not have to be this way
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sensible policies can be pursued by Tbilisi to address the legitimate grievances of the Javakheti Armenians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The West can make it clear to Russia that further meddling in Georgia's domestic affairs could lead to additional sanctions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The last thing the South Caucasus needs is another sectarian conflict
paragraphs.label: assumption
